context: This is why development of our own sources of oil is so important. We are now energy independent and don't need any from the Middle East. I grew up in the 70's and remember well sitting in the car in line to buy what little gas was available because OPEC decided to shut off the tap to the US. Democrat Jimmy Carter was President and his policies allowed us to be held hostage by the Middle East oil producing nations because he refused to allow oil production here. In 1979 Iran's government was taken over by radical Islamist's and here we are 40 years later. Gas prices up temporarily 1.4%, so what, it could be and has been much worse. Thanks to President Trump we are in a good position to weather this type of problem.

replies.context: OK, so please do share.  What are these "atrocities" you're speaking to?

I'm sorry, do you not know how to use Google? I'll sum them up for you. Let's leave aside the literal butchering of a dissident journalist on the crown prince's order. In Yemen, the Saudis have deliberately bombed for supplies; their strategy is to starve the enemy (here, the whole Yemeni people, down to the last baby) into submission. There is now a famine in Yemen that is killing thousands, and it was a direct and intended result of these bombings. It is unspeakably cruel and barbaric.

I guess you are not capable of retaining information. The war between Iran's proxy and Saudi Arabia is old news and it has been reported on many occasions.  Life must suck with the attention span of a goldfish.
Starving Yemeni kids are Iran's proxy? The Saudi operation in Yemen isn't punishing the Houthis. It's brutalizing the Yemeni people. The worst humanitarian crisis in the world right now.
